thread.title: WSJ: Anthem closes in on pact to buy Cigna
thread.title_full: WSJ: Anthem closes in on pact to buy Cigna

title: WSJ: Anthem closes in on pact to buy Cigna
text:
Anthem Nears Deal to Buy Cigna Deal would continue insurer consolidation, value Cigna at around $187 a share By Dana Mattioli And Liz Hoffman 30 minutes ago  . View photo People enter the office building of health insurer Anthem in Los Angeles, California February 5, 2015. REUTERS/Gus Ruelas 
Anthem Inc. is nearing a deal to buy Cigna Corp. for more than $48 billion in a transaction that would dramatically reshape the health-insurance industry.Anthem is expected to pay about $187 a share for Cigna, according to people familiar with the matter. A deal between the two companies could be announced as soon as Thursday afternoon, one of them said. The deal still hasn’t been signed, though, and the timing could still slip.A takeover agreement would cap off a monthslong and sometimes contentious mating dance, with Anthem at one point going public with its offer. It would follow by about three weeks an agreement by Aetna Inc. to buy Humana Inc. for $34 billion .Should both deals be blessed by regulators and completed, they would shrink the number of major health insurers in the country to three from five.Write to Dana Mattioli at dana.mattioli@wsj.com and Liz Hoffman at liz.hoffman@wsj.com 
More From The Wall Street Journal
